title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement mimail@vicky.com. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to meteorologia
text: outlines propose change meteorologia. detailed discussion contributing tidyverse packages, please see development contributing guide code review principles.

title: Contributing to meteorologia
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to meteorologia
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed). See guide create great issue advice.

title: Contributing to meteorologia
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("celestedallago/meteorologia", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to meteorologia
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to meteorologia
text: Please note meteorologia project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: Datos Meteorologicos
text: El obetivo del paquete meteorologia es tener diferentes funciones que nos sirvan para leer y analizar datos metorologia….

title: Datos Meteorologicos
text: Puedes instalar la versión de desarrollo de meteorologia desde GitHub :

title: Datos Meteorologicos
text: Este es un ejemplo básico que muestra cómo resolver un problema común:
code: library(meteorologia) simular_meteorologia() #> $temperatura #> [1] 8 #>  #> $precipitacion #> [1] 50 #esto me devuelve dos pares de valores de manera aleatoria, una haciendo referencia a la temperatura y otro a la precipitacion

title: Leer archivos — leer_archivo
text: Lo que hace esta funcion es leer tu archivo, puede ser tanto URL como rutas locales

title: Leer archivos — leer_archivo
text: ruta

title: Leer archivos — leer_archivo
text: Te devuelve el archivo leido

title: Leer archivos — leer_archivo
text: # lee archivos

title: Conjunto de datos metereologicos — meteorologia_raw_data
text: Los datos son utilizados para diferentes funciones

title: Conjunto de datos metereologicos — meteorologia_raw_data
text: conjunto de datos con 35 columnas y 17041 filas id ID de la estación realizada. fecha Fecha de la medición. temperatura_abrigo_150cm Temperatura medida 150 cm de altura. temperatura_abrigo_150cm_maxima Temperatura máxima 150 cm. temperatura_abrigo_150cm_minima Temperatura mínima 150 cm. temperatura_intemperie_5cm_minima Temperatura mínima en intemperie 5 cm. temperatura_intemperie_50cm_minima Temperatura mínima en intemperie 50 cm. temperatura_suelo_5cm_media Temperatura media del suelo 5 cm. temperatura_suelo_10cm_media Temperatura media del suelo 10 cm. temperatura_inte_5cm Temperatura interna 5 cm. temperatura_intemperie_150cm_minima Temperatura mínima en intemperie 150 cm. humedad_suelo Humedad del suelo. precipitacion_pluviometrica Precipitación medida. granizo 1 si hubo granizo y 0 si hubo. nieve 1 si hubo nieve y 0 si hubo. heliofania_efectiva Heliofanía efectiva. heliofania_relativa Heliofanía relativa. tesion_vapor_media Tensión de vapor media. humedad_media Humedad media. humedad_media_8_14_20 Humedad media de 8 14 y 20. rocio_medio Rocío medio. duracion_follaje_mojado Duración del follaje mojado. velocidad_viento_200cm_media Velocidad media del viento 200 cm. direccion_viento_200cm Dirección del viento 200 cm. velocidad_viento_1000cm_media Velocidad media del viento 1000 cm. direccion_viento_1000cm Dirección del viento 1000 cm. velocidad_viento_maxima Velocidad máxima del viento. presion_media Presión media. radiacion_global Radiación global. radiacion_neta Radiación neta. evaporacion_tanque Evaporación en tanque. evapotranspiracion_potencial Evapotranspiración potencial. profundidad_napa Profundidad de napa. horas_frio Horas de frío. unidad_frio Unidad de frío. @source datos obtenidos de una url

what: Minimos y maximos por por fecha — min_max_por_mes
title: Minimos y maximos por por fecha — min_max_por_mes
text: La funcion 'min_max_por_estacion()' te devuelve las temperaturas minimas y maximas registradas en cada mes La funcion 'min_max_por_mes()' te devuelve las temperaturas minimas y maximas registradas en cada mes

title: Minimos y maximos por por fecha — min_max_por_mes
code: min_max_por_estacion() #> Error in min_max_por_estacion(): could not find function "min_max_por_estacion" min_max_por_mes() #> Error in datos %>% mutate(mes = format(as.Date(fecha), "%Y-%m")) %>% group_by(mes) %>%     summarise(temp_min = min(temperatura, na.rm = TRUE), temp_max = max(temperatura,         na.rm = TRUE)): could not find function "%>%"

title: Simular meteorologia — simular_meteorologia
text: La funcion simular_meteorologia() te devuelve de manera random una temperatura y una precipitacion, hace uso de parametros

title: Simular meteorologia — simular_meteorologia
text: Dos valores, uno haciendo referencia la temperatura, y otro la presipitacion Ejemplo: 10, 38
